outputs.output_descr: The Stockholm Convention requires countries that are parties to the convention to give priority consideration to waste treatment processes, techniques and practices that avoid the unintentional formation and release of persistent organic pollutants (POPs), such as dioxins. However, many countries lack the ability or resources to comply with these obligations. The Global Environment Facility is funding this project to demonstrate the effectiveness of improved healthcare waste management practices and technologies in order that other Stockholm Convention signatory countries may use these models as they set their own national healthcare waste management priorities.

project_title: PIMS 2596 POP FSP: Reducing Health-Care Waste
